sources.text: p.371. Having remained a widow fifteen years, in 1807 Esther Hunt was united in marriage with John Collins, a member and elder of Chester Monthly Meeting, New Jersey.
sources.citation: Esther Collins and Ann Edwards, The Friend, a Religious and Literary Journal, vol. 46, no. 47, July 12, 1873

sources.text: p. 77. John Collins of Chester Monthly Meeting in the County of Burlington in the State of New Jersey, son of Francis Collins and Ann his Wife of the same place, deceased; and Esther Hunt, widow of Joshua Hunt of Redstone Monthly Meeting, Fayette County, State of Pennsylvania, Daughter of Enoch Roberts and Rachel his Wife of Burlington County, state of New Jersey, deceased; were married the 3rd day of the 6th month in year of our lord 1807.
sources.citation: Redstone Monthly Meeting, Marriage 1793-1833, via Ancestry.com search, January 22, 2021

sources.text: p. 13. John Collins, born 27th of 11th Month 1749; John deceased 2nd month 23rd 1817 in the 68 year of his age; Ruth his wife born 16th of 4th Month 1750; Ruth Collins departed this life 5th of 10th month 1805.
sources.citation: Record of births and burials for Chester Monthly Meeting begun in 7th month 1804, via Ancestry.com search, January 22, 2021

sources.text: p. 16. The children of John Collins, son of Francis Collins, born 27th of 11th Month 1749, and Ruth his wife, Daughter of Arthur Burdil, Born the 16th of the 4th Month 1750: Anna Collins, 1772-1773; John Collins, 1775-1777; Phebe Collins, 1777-; Rhoda Collins, 1780-; Job Collins, 1782-; Arthur Collins, 1786-
sources.citation: First Record Book of Births and Deaths of Members of Evesham Monthly Meeting, via Ancestry.com search, January 22, 2021

biogHists.text: John Collins was a Quaker from Burlington County, New Jersey. He was born in early 1750 (late 1749 old style) to Francis and Ann Collins and married Ruth Burdil, born 1750 to Arthur Burdil. Ruth died in 1805, and in 1807 Collins remarried, this time Esther Hunt (née Roberts), widow of Joshua Hunt, who was also native to Burlington County but had lived for over a decade in Fayette County, Pennsylvania. Both Collins and his second wife were recognized as elders of Chester Monthly Meeting. He died February 23, 1817

relations.content: Chester Monthly Meeting (Society of Friends : 1803-1827 : Moorestown, N.J.)

relations.note: John Collins was the brother of Job Collins, husband of Elizabeth Collins (née Ballinger).
John Collins married Esther Hunt (née Roberts) on 3 June 1807 under the care of Redstone Meeting.

relations.note: John Collins was the son of Francis Collins, the brother of Joshua Evans's wife Priscilla Collins.
John Collins married Esther Hunt (née Roberts), widow of Joshua Hunt, who was John Hunt's half-brother.

resource.title: Roberts-Hunt family papers, 1677-1829.
resource.abstract: This collection includes papers relating to Rachel H. Roberts and her family. Included is correspondence between Esther Hunt Collins and her first husband, Joshua Hunt, his brother John, her children Elisha, Caleb and Rachel, her second husband, John Collins, and Hannah Yarnall. Also included is correspondence between Rachel H. Roberts and her husband, David. The collection includes genealogical information on the Roberts, Hooton, and other related families, along with wills and account books of Joseph and Susanna Roberts. Letters relate family news, impressions of Redstone Monthly Meeting of Friends, and discussions of Quaker discipline.
resource.displayEntry: Roberts, Rachel H., 1791-1881. Roberts-Hunt family papers, 1677-1829.

nameEntries.original: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

resource.title: John Hunt papers, 1770-1828.
resource.abstract: John Hunt kept a diary for more than 40 years, recording Quaker concerns and daily events. This collections consists primarily of the manuscript journal, 1770-1800; fragments of 1805, 1806 & 1808; and 1814-1824. Of particular interest are the visits of prominent Quakers, including Elias Hicks and Jonathan Evans. There is also an account book, some correspondence received, and other miscellaneous materials. Correspondents include Ann R. Matlack, Asa Matlack, Elizabeth A. Lippincott, John Cox, Joseph Foulke, and Josiah Roberts.

nameEntries.original: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College
